MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
The next day, I met up with Ohana before heading out into town. The ingredients for the Train Knights' diets
are usually ordered and then delivered, but today's goal was a bit different.

Apparently, Ohana buys spices and seasonings only after seeing them with her own eyes. Although not as heavy as meat, even the lightest spices would be needed to be bought in large quantities.
A bag carrier was absolutely required.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Thank you, Conductor.
I was able to buy so much♪
Not a problem. But that was a lot of work just to pick spices. I had no idea you put so much work into grocery shopping. I feel like I've gotten a hint as to why your food is so delicious.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
There are many types of sugar alone, aren't there? Pure white sugar doesn't add any extra color to the food,
but brown sugar adds a richer taste.

You always put a lot of effort into making meals for everyone.
Thank you, Ohana.

She is an excellent housemother,
but she is also a talented martial arts instructor. I really can't get over it.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
It's almost time for the Train Knights' training♪
I'm gonna give them a tough workout.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
If I can get everyone home safely with tough training, I won't cut corners,
even if it makes them cry.

You have such a strong heart.
I should learn from you.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
...That's not true, Conductor.
You do know a bit about my past, don't you?
Ohana was one of the original candidates for the SSS - the zeroth generation -/nwho were gathered before the Mist Train was completed.

Ohana, who was working as a cook at an ammunitions factory in Nishiki at the time, was scouted by military officials and came to St. Iris as a zeroth generation student. I heard that she was such an excellent cadet that she was leading the zeroth gen students as head of the student dormitory.

I also know about the sad incident that happened back then.
However, there is not much I know about Ohana's time in Nishiki.

I had been curious about it for quite some time. If she was a factory cook in Nishiki, why is she so powerful?
She still seems to be connected to Nishiki's army...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
...My father was a martial artist. He had a dojo. He practiced fighting all day, every day.
He was a very strict man. I don't even remember him smiling at me.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
My father always told me I was a bad daughter. I never lost to any of his students,
but all I could think about was the bad feedback he gave me.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I am weak. I am inexperienced.
I am unfit to fight.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I never thought I was strong
until my mother did her best to pull me away from him.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
But there is a difference between having confidence in yourself and having a strong heart. I was never strong enough to fight on the battlefield...
That's why I couldn't save everyone back then.

Are you talking about "that incident",
where Finchley left the zeroth generation?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
That's right. I'm referring to "the incident" where a large number of the zeroth generation students and their knight escorts lost their lives.
The worst incident that's ever happened during field training...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
In order to protect the younger members, I went to the aid of the older members of the Order. I have to do it. I can do it.
That's what I told myself as I cut through the enemy lines by myself.
But then something unexpected happened.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Yes... Finchley followed me. It was not a sistuation that Finchley could have handled at the time. She couldn't keep up with me and broke formation, putting the whole squad in danger.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I should have turned Finchley away when she tried to join us. That's what any normal commander would do.
But I just couldn't...It's all my fault.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: As a result, we had to retreat into the Mist. Not only that, but I also traumatized my cute junior... Even remembering it now, I feel like scolding myself.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
And because of that, I decided to resign from my position as dorm leader and leave the SSS.
I'm not strong at all.

But you always supported the SSS from behind the scenes.
You take pride in your work as the housemother, don't you?
And that's not all. You're back on the stage. As a Train Knight in the SSS, you fight well on the battlefield. All the young ones respect you as a strong and dependable person.

You're not weak at all, Ohana. You're a powerful, prideful Train Knight.
Am I wrong?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
No, you're not. I am a Train Knight.
I fight to protect everyone.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Thank you, Conductor.
I feel so much better now.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Ohana
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
By the way, do you mind staying with me a little while longer?
There's a place I'd like to stop by♪
Ohana turned her feet in the opposite direction, towards the garrison.
